sofya.ed.semantic
Class EventListener.MethodData

java.lang.Object
  sofya.ed.semantic.EventListener.MethodData
Enclosing interface:
EventListener
public static class EventListener.MethodData
extends java.lang.Object

Provides information about entry into a method.

Method Summary
 boolean canGetArguments()
          Reports whether the values of the arguments passed to the method can be retrieved; this is true only on method entry events.
 int getAccessFlags()
          Gets the Java access flags for the method, as defined in the Java Virtual Machine Specification.
 EventListener.Arguments getArguments()
          Gets the arguments to the method.
 java.lang.String getRawSignature()
          Gets the signature string recorded by the probe for the entered method.
 MethodSignature getSignature()
          Gets the signature of the entered method.
 boolean isPrivate()
          Reports whether the method has private access.
 boolean isProtected()
          Reports whether the method has protected access.
 boolean isPublic()
          Reports whether the method has public access.

Method Detail

getSignature

public MethodSignature getSignature()
Gets the signature of the entered method.

Returns:
The signature of the entered method.

getRawSignature

public java.lang.String getRawSignature()
Gets the signature string recorded by the probe for the entered method.

Returns:
The raw signature string of the entered method.

canGetArguments

public boolean canGetArguments()
Reports whether the values of the arguments passed to the method can be retrieved; this is true only on method entry events.

Returns:
true if the values of the arguments to the method can be obtained.

getArguments

public EventListener.Arguments getArguments()
Gets the arguments to the method.

Returns:
An object that provides access to information about the actual parameters passed to the method.

getAccessFlags

public int getAccessFlags()
                   throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the Java access flags for the method, as defined in the Java Virtual Machine Specification.

Returns:
The integer bitmask corresponding to the access flags that are set for the method.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the instrumentation version does not support the delivery of this information, or the instrumentation is corrupted in some way.

isPublic

public boolean isPublic()
                 throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Reports whether the method has public access.

Returns:
true if the method is public, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the instrumentation version does not support the delivery of this information, or the instrumentation is corrupted in some way.

isProtected

public boolean isProtected()
                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Reports whether the method has protected access.

Returns:
true if the method is protected, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the instrumentation version does not support the delivery of this information, or the instrumentation is corrupted in some way.

isPrivate

public boolean isPrivate()
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Reports whether the method has private access.

Returns:
true if the method is private, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the instrumentation version does not support the delivery of this information, or the instrumentation is corrupted in some way.
